main event: Multiple unidentified flying objects were observed in the vicinity of Creola, Alabama in 1952 and 1953, with descriptions of bright, metallic, circular, and reddish-glowing objects traveling at high speeds and exhibiting unusual flight characteristics.
interesting points: One object was observed to make an abrupt 90-degree turn and continue at a high rate of speed, and it left no visible trail.
The USAF Radar Laboratory personnel in New York reported no unusual radar targets in the area during the sighting.
An object was sighted traveling higher than any aircraft previously seen, and it appeared to be fairly large in size.
Five unidentified flying objects were observed by six individuals in the vicinity of Creola, Alabama over a period from 31 July through 17 August 1953.
Two observers reported a silent, bright, orange-colored object, approximately 30 to 40 feet in diameter, moving slowly from north to south at an estimated altitude of 2,000 feet.
sighted object: Multiple unidentified flying objects, including bright metallic, circular, and reddish-glowing objects
